definition:
[**Definition**]{} Suppose $X$ is a non-empty topological space and
$x_0$ is an element of $X$. Then the pair $(X,x_0)$ is called a *pointed
topological space*, or a *based topological space*.

The idea with pointed topological spaces is simply that one fixes a base
point in the space. This is necessary, for instance, when defining the
fundamental group of a topological space.
